Traits.Name: Rearranging Structure
Traits.Content: The Architectural Shifter can subtly alter its surroundings, causing walls and furniture to shift positions at the start of its turn, making it difficult to navigate through.

Traits.Name: Trap Setting
Traits.Content: When a creature ends its turn within 15 feet of the Architectural Shifter, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained by shifting furniture.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Architectural Shifter makes three attacks: one with its Restructuring Strike and two with its Trapping Slam.

Actions.Name: Restructuring Strike
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) damage plus 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage as the very walls of the room shift and strike the target.

Actions.Name: Trapping Slam
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) damage as nearby furniture aggressively shifts and slams into the target, knocking them off balance. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Room Collapse (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: The Architectural Shifter unleashes a wave of chaotic structural energy in a 30‚Äêfoot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also become trapped underneath the chaos of shifting debris until they succeed on a DC 15 Strength check to escape.
